title.narrative: SWE-2010-138 Designing climate-smart water adaptation strategies for sustainable urban development. A study of Cochahamba, Phnom Penh and Kota.
SWE-2010-138 Designing climate-smart water adaptation strategies for sustainable urban development. A study of Cochahamba, Phnom Penh and Kota.

description.narrative: The aim of the project is to assess the vulnerability and adaptive capacity in 3 cities and to formulate planning strategies that address the major impacts of climate changes. Planning for water (storm- potable- and wastewater) is in focus. A toolbox for participatory vulnerability assessments with local communities and authorities has been developed with reference to climate change in Sweden and the Baltic countries. In this study, we want to customize and test the tool box in three urban areas in Bolivia, India and Cambodia. These urban centres represent large but not megacities in different countries with varied water situation and climate change impacts. The project outcome will contribute to improved urban water management in developing countries through an improved methodology of vulnerability assessments and specific empirical understanding of the three case study contexts.
